intro: Calceolaria mollissima, commonly known as the velvet crownflower, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its soft, velvety leaves and showy, hooded flowers that resemble small bells. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky areas.
